communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documents or records outlining the protocol or standard operating procedures for how 911 calls are assessed and directed by dispatchers, including decision-making criteria for determining whether calls are handled by police, fire department, emergency medical services (EMS), and/or HEART (Holistic Empathetic Assistance Response Teams), including CCD, CRT, and COR teams.

Any documentation regarding eligibility criteria for assigning calls to HEART or other alternative response teams.

Information or guidelines provided to dispatchers to determine the appropriate response based on factors such as: call type (e.g., mental health-related, violent incidents, medical emergencies), presence of weapons, threats of violence.

I would appreciate any related documents, training materials, flowcharts, or memos detailing the above processes.

If any part of this request is unclear or requires refinement, please let me know, and I will be happy to provide clarification. If there are fees associated with fulfilling this request, I would appreciate an estimate before proceeding.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

bocar ba

title: Matching 911 Data to Police Incident Data

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Information regarding how to connect the following two publicly available datasets: 

911 data: https://data.cincinnati-oh.gov/Safety/Emergency-Communications-Center-ECC-Calls/5f3f-hgt9/about_data
Police Incident data: https://data.cincinnati-oh.gov/safety/PDI-Police-Data-Initiative-Crime-Incidents/k59e-2pvf/about_data

Is there a master incident or event number?

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

bocar ba

title: Salary of All City of NYC Employees

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Salary of All City of NYC Employees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Payment/salary information for any and all employees of the City of New York, NY who received payment January 4-8, 2021. CSV or TXT file with the following column headers:

Name
Salary
Position
DOB
Appointment date
Department
Start date
End date

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

bocar ba
